intro: Acetosella sepium, commonly known as mouse ear chickweed, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its small, fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Acetosella sepium is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ornamental value as well as its ecological importance in supporting insect life.
